website_summaries.verdict: An attractive design with innovative arms and sturdy construction ensure that this wall hanger will hold your bike securely in place.
pros: Cyclists who fret about their road bikes will love the padded arms and sturdy aluminum construction
The adjustable arms hold the bike level at an ideal angle for the frame, even bikes with sloping top tubes
cons: The front strap stabilizer is difficult to tighten properly

customer_reviews.title: Mount it into two studs if you can
customer_reviews.text: I've put up three of these in my house and I couldn't be happier. I have two bits of advice: 1. Don't use the wall-mounting screws that come in the package. Get over to the hardware store and get something better. 2. If you really want this thing to be securely mounted, put it into a board long enough to straddle two studs, and mount the whole thing to the wall. I've attached a photo for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Received it super quick (thanks Prime) and was extremely easy to install. Even if you need the instructions (which you shouldn't - pretty self-explanatory) the directions are straight forward and easy to follow. The hardware (screws/wall anchors) are all great quality. I was able to get two of the screws in a standard 2x4 wood stud and the third using one of the wall anchors in the drywall. Has been up for a few weeks and holds my Cannondale mountain bike (Medium 29er) great. Super easy to adjust position from wall and angle of bike as well. Happy customer👍
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miazgowicz

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: It's doing well for day one! Our wall didn't have many studs, so we decided to spicy it up a bit and mount a 80x8x1 inch cedar board along the whole wall for extra support. The product it's self seems very sturdy and not going anywhere.. We think it really looks great, and hope it holds up well! Will update if fails
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Fell after 3 months...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, as another reviewer has pointed out, you cannot hope to get all 3 screws into one standard-width wall stud. We had our wall hanger installed with 2/3 screws in a stud and 1 screw in the drywall with an anchor, but the hanger (and the bike) fell off the wall within 3 months. I may consider trying this again, but next time will mount on a piece of wood spanning 2 studs. Aside from the mounting issue, this bike hanger seems to be decent quality and worked well while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: JamieTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this product for a while. It was easy to hang and I was really pleased with it at first. But after taking the bike down several times, one of the gears for the arms got loose and slipped a few times and completely worn down the part that will hold the arm in place!! See pics of the two gears for the arms-the one that’s still good and the other is like a split screw. It seemed way more durable than that at first, but one slip and it’s now useless and too old to return :(
customer_reviews.author: Megan Goode

customer_reviews.title: Locking Mechanism Strips Easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike rack several months ago, and with just a few uses the rack's locking mechanism has stripped (see video) rendering the product useless. I like the design, but the quality of materials is weak.
customer_reviews.author: Neeshka

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed or defective unit.  One side keeps disengaging on its own.
customer_reviews.text: I was very happy with this hanger once I mounted on the wall and put the bicycle on it. I then noticed that if try to leave the holding hooks at any angle other than at the down position, they disengage on their own (the teeth are not well built). I missed the returned window because I did not start using this until a few weeks after I purchase it. I'm not sure if I just received a defective unit or this is just the way the hanger was designed. I wouldn't buy this if I were me again.
customer_reviews.author: MA0X2

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for kids bike
customer_reviews.text: my son has a 16 inch mangoose bike. reading all the reviews and learnt its the best one available on the market, we purchased and installed in our garage. We even followed few reviewers suggesting a 4 inch by 1 inch plank mounting first covering two studs and then installing. We were excited to finish the mount and then realized the bike bar is too small and even with the arms much closer to each other we could not hang our bike. Very disappointing. Now its all mount and ready and we cannot use it and my son is still leaving the bike on floor. very expensive and i dont see any solution
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Weak Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Well at first I wanted to give this 5 stars but after following installation instructions and usage instructions one of the teeth are broken so it doesn't hold the bike right. I mean I tried to contact the company and all I got back were Chinese letters. The warranty appears to not cover if you purchase it through Amazon, I would say if you want to get them go for it, just don't expect the warranty to be honored by Ibera.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Failed within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Good design concept, but... Mine just failed this morning. Right arm rachet no longer holds position or weight - so it can't hold my bike. I have a Quick Carbon, so not a lot of stress on the hanger. Lasted less than 3 months. Hopefully this is not commonplace, but for all the other cyclists who struggle finding a hanger solution which is space friendly - this is something you should know.
customer_reviews.author: Caseyb7

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and simple
customer_reviews.text: This was somewhat easy to install. the only difficulty comes in trying to center the mount on your stud if you have drywall over it. This thing basically has to be exactly in the center because it has side by side screws on the top and you want to make sure all of them go into the stud. I was impressed with this product because my cross bar on my bike is not circular (more like an upside down triangle - it is a triathlon bike) and I was worried it wouldn't hold my bike well. However, after installation I quickly realized I was wrong. It holds the bike perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bike Rack
customer_reviews.text: We recently downsized and I needed to be able to hang my bike on the wall. I tried a few others but they were all bulky and/or were difficult to assemble ar attach to the wall. This one is perfect for my needs. Easily attaches to the wall and has a telescoping rod so you can customize how near to the wall you want to place your bike. The "wings" that your bike rests on are adjustable, giving you the ability to customize the rack to your specific bike. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Neil

customer_reviews.title: Will not hold the weight of the bike with included hardware
customer_reviews.text: The included hardware which includes cheap plastic expansion type fasteners dropped straight into the space behind the drywall. I got better drywall fasteners and tried again but this time the leverage introduced by the design of the rack began pulling the top two fastener threads straight out of the drywall. You see, when you pull the rack out to accommodate for large handlebars, it introduces a lot of rotational leverage, pulling the top fastener threads (there are 3--two on top and one on bottom). Ended up ripping up my drywall. It would probably work ok if attached directly to studs, but I'm done with this rack. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: detroit_md

customer_reviews.title: Simply fantastic
customer_reviews.text: The girlfriend has 2 road bikes worth $14,000 (yeah, she has expensive taste with Cannondale and Specialized). These installed easily (put in studs, used a 2.5" screw vs. factory screws). There is no way these are coming off the wall. They look great, protect the bike, and easy to adjust the bikes to level. Bought the first one 3 months ago and the second one 2 weeks ago. This would be my go-to recommendation for a wall mount. I trust it with these expensive bikes, just buy it and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Everett

customer_reviews.title: Great for tight spots
customer_reviews.text: This is great for fitting bikes into tight spaces. I was able to get two bikes to the right of my car. Step 1) pick up your bike with two hands to feel the weight and imagine / line up how it will hang on the rack Step 2) get a ladder, hold the bike where you think it should be and mark a spot with a pencil on the wall Step 3) find a stud with a stud finder Step 4) move your spot over and mark with pencil using the rack Step 5) hammer a small nail softly in each hole to confirm studs (and no pipes) Step 6) drill and screw in the rack
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Atherton

customer_reviews.title: Best Bike Brackets and Extremely Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made bike hangers. They are super easy to install with some prior prep work. First, if you are installing on drywall you will need to apply a backing plate. I chose a pine stair tread since it was wide enough and thick enough. Secondly, although the screws to mount the bracket are adequate enough I wanted something a little stronger 1/4” x 1 1/2” bolts as shown and I used 1/4” x 4” bolts in the backer plate through the drywall into the studs. Overall these are the best bike brackets I have ever seen. Definitely worth their cost.
customer_reviews.author: Zheng, Ying

customer_reviews.title: Really great, but possibly weak metal?
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one for wife and one for me. We used one for a few weeks, really liked it, and then decided to change which wall it was mounted on and to mount the second. I'm not sure which mount was faulty, but one of them now supports no weight on one arm. The metal on the gears scraped away so that when you apply weight it just jumps of the gears until it can't move anymore. The other one is still standing strong. Would have gotten it replaced except we had them for a few months before we ended up mounting then
customer_reviews.author: thothsscribe

customer_reviews.title: Arm slips under the weight of a carbon road bike
customer_reviews.text: Sorry... I really wanted to like this bike hanger. It was simple to install and for the first few months did its job admirably. But after only 6 months of holding an under-20 lb road bike the spring on the right arm was incapable of keeping the pawl in place and so the arm slips, dropping my bike to the floor. Luckily, the left arm stayed in place, so the bike wasn't damaged. At first I though I had done something wrong so I reset the ratchet to its original location. Same thing happened again. The weak spring is the culprit. Too bad, but I'll be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Gideon Ansell

customer_reviews.title: Right Arm Slips Under Weight of My Bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I had stored this item before finally unboxing it months after it was delivered. It worked for about a month, then one day the right arm started slipping "gears" downward under the weight of my bicycle. This caused the back & front end of my bicycle to slip down the arm grips, to avoid risk of it falling I took the bike down and examined the arms. The teeth of the arm are coming off track and slipping, causing the right arm to drop suddenly. Is there a manufacturer's warranty?
customer_reviews.author: David M. Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased two of these and the 2nd one is terrible. I experienced the same problem others have posted ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these and the 2nd one is terrible. I experienced the same problem others have posted in that the adjustable gear on the right side continues to fail resulting in my expensive <20lb bike routinely falling onto the concrete garage floor. Luckily, my bike never fell when my car was parked next to it; otherwise, it could've scratched up my vehicle real bad.
customer_reviews.author: HP_Steffey

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else! Strips easily like many others have stated
customer_reviews.text: Lame product. Like many others have said here, the arm ratchets strip super easily and render it useless. I carefully loaded and unloaded the bike from this wall rack around 25 times before the thing gave out. Terrible. Buy ANYTHING else.
customer_reviews.author: JB SRQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfecto!
customer_reviews.text: Does what I wanted and it took me all but 5 minutes to install. I bet you could do a chinup on this thing if you've got it in the wall stud. I'd definitely say you're good to go even with hefty mountain bikes. The welds don't look wimpy to me. Included is a really long strip of velcro for keeping your handlebars straight. I only needed about 10 inches for my roadie. The arm is extendable. However, I don't think it would accommodate really wide 760mm or wider handlebars. My Salsa bars are about 600mm at the bar ends and they fit fine. I have the arm extended about half way.
customer_reviews.author: Ben's Real Review

customer_reviews.title: Stores our bicycles safely, out of the way
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with these bike racks. We share a carport with the other duplex tenants and park a car and motorcycle under our side. This left little room for our bicycles until I ordered and installed two of these sweet racks on one of the center posts. I did the installation myself, with a little adaptation to ensure the safety of our bikes. They store safely, out of the way, and are easy to access when we want to ride. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Artwork
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful cycle mount. The ratchet features are cool as heck. The quality is outstanding. The bike can be hanging level no matter how the frame is made. It allows you to extend it out from the wall enough so I can keep my mountain bike handlebars straight. I wish I would of bought it along time ago. My other wall mounts are junk compared to this one. I plan on ordering more in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: todd theobald

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy! Easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: Asked my property manager if I could hang my bike up and he said yes, so I did. This thing is super sturdy and easy to install. My Cadent is about 26-28 lbs and it sits up there nice and sturdy. I even shook it a bit to see and the bike moved by the rack didn’t. Obviously people, if you’re hanging this up on drywall, like I did, use a beam finder to find a 2x4 and screw it into that... not the drywall!! Have no complaints, super great buy!
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Stable, adjustable, fits newer non circular top tubes
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this to some 3/4" plywood that I first mounted to studs in my garage. The hanger attached very tightly to the plywood and is very sturdy. The arms are adjustable enough to accommodate bikes with both horizontal top tubes as well as those that are angular. The arms that contact the top tube are wide enough to accommodate oval or oval/flat top tubes in use today, without marring the paint. Very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lovett

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: As stated by other buyers, my product broke within three weeks. The installation went great and secures very nicely to the wall/stud. The problem is with the actual design/mechanism. There are "teeth" that allow for adjusting the height of the bike. Unfortunately, the teeth are too shallow and made of a material that can't properly support a 24lb bike. Very poor design and overall useless now.
customer_reviews.author: WATERJETSKI

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and seems sturdy but....
customer_reviews.text: It’s great. It really is. Easy and highly adjustable. The only thing is... I mounted to a stud using center and right as well as bottom holes. The hardware they give you is not strong enough for that work. But some good strong screws. These stripped extremely easy. But again once I got it in with good screws it was fantastic. Update. Bought another for my wife’s bike. Still awesome
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Schumacher

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed with thicker than expected metal, super easy to mount to stud & easily adjust to any style of bike frame.
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed with thicker than expected metal, super easy to mount to stud & easily adjust to any style of bike frame; would recommend swapping out the Allen wrench head screws that comes with it to a Phillips head screw (that worked out better) as the Allen wrench size states a "4", but it's more of a size 2.5 (too small for a 2 and too large for a 3).
customer_reviews.author: Yorkie8044

customer_reviews.title: Not for large tube bikes.
customer_reviews.text: This product assembles and installs relatively easy but for bikes with larger tubes like my old Cannondale, there isn't enough contact with the support arms so the bike can slides backwards until the seat tube hits the rear support arm. Of course I was able to adjust the right arm to point the bike down but I was basically disappointed and I strongly favor the bike wall mount by Pro Bike Tool.
customer_reviews.author: Houckster

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Okay. It’s only been about 5 hours, since it’s been hanging and so far so good. I found the stud that’s behind the dry wall and drilled into it, which seems to be holding my bike pretty well. I was nervous, since its drywall, and you have to drill it into the stud, or buy your own if you don’t have it in your wall. It looks great though!!! I’m so happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Wish The Base Was Larger
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made but the mounting plate is too narrow. Once mounted to the wall, the bottom of the plate dug into the drywall as the load was limited to a 1.5" area, not spread out. So I had to fabricate a 6" x 8" x 0.25" aluminum backing plate to distribute the load on the drywall. It worked! One more thing, it could use adjustable pads that also grip, these don't.
customer_reviews.author: Cappy

customer_reviews.title: Works good for light weight bikes.
customer_reviews.text: Beware. The holes in which you drill the bike holder into the wall, one hole will go into your stud in the wall but the bottom hole and other side hole will miss and you will feel unsure about it staying in the wall. My bike is an Aventon Córdoba Fixed gear bike and it only weighs 18 lbs. I wouldn’t put a bike heavier than 25 lbs on this bike holder. In my case it works perfect and looks nice. Another suggested bike rack would be DaHanger Bike Hanger. :)
customer_reviews.author: Sean D.

customer_reviews.title: Broke After a Year
customer_reviews.text: This was a good bike wall hanger until one of the hangers broke. The notch won't catch so it falls all the way to the bottom. I was expecting it to last longer than a year. I will say that the hex screws became loose so maybe that had something to do with it, and it is pretty inexpensive. Regardless, I can't recommend this product. Ironically, I'm going to buy it again because I already have the holes drilled and I need it to match. I'm going to keep the hex screws tightened!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Great product but does take planning and time to install correctly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to store four bikes in as little space as possible. These bike racks worked very well for that. It was tedious installing the 1x6 for them to be mounted on and getting the right height and spacing takes planning. I like that all the bikes sit horizontally with the adjustable arms. Also the top hybrid bikes have wider handlebars, so being able to adjust for those was key. You can see that the overall space occupied by the bikes is minimal. Very happy with product.
customer_reviews.author: Brinkley B. Pound

customer_reviews.title: easy to install & solid construction, just what I was looking for...
customer_reviews.text: 1st rack is made of aluminum which is what I needed for my beach condo, no rust! It is solid and the bike hangs without any concern of falling. Reading other reviews I used double the length of the screws (2.5") to the concrete wall, made of stainless steel. It is well anchored to the wall by following the instructions by using 3 screws. Only negative, it should bring the Allen tool for the screws which are attached to the base and the rack, luckily I had one which is metric but not everyone has one.
customer_reviews.author: Tito

customer_reviews.title: These work pretty well
customer_reviews.text: Installation is straightforward... be certain to have a stud or other strong material to mount on. The rack design allows the user to adjust the "holders" to suit various bike designs. That works fairly well. The weakness that I have experienced is that the cams that determine where the arms set do not lock in place. As a result, if you hit one while placing the bike on the rack, it will move out of position. Some sort of positive engagement would be beneficial.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: If you have a mountain bike, don't bother with this mount.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. Total junk. Claims you can mount and adjust to keep level. To do that you have to put one of the arms between the frame and front wheel. But then this area gets jammed and makes it really difficult to remove from wall. If you do depend on the adjustment in the device, beware... These are not very robust. I latched it as intended and 5 minutes later it unlatched on its own. So I gave up and got a different mount.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Failing after 3 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, one of them works great. Overall, very flexible and strong design. The second one however has a defective part so the right arm slips on the teeth intended to hold the bar in position after only a few weeks of use. My bike literally fell off the the rack when the right arm failed and crashed to the ground. If I could I would return both of them in fear I can't trust the product now.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Functional, innovative, and high-quality. Just what I wanted.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this cycle holder. It's on the expensive side when compared with other options on Amazon, but in this case I got what I paid for. The manufacturing is high quality with tight tolerances and nice materials. The clever ratchet system for easy adjustment of the arms is functional and precise. The finish is also high quality. The strap for the front wheel, however; isn't like the one in the product video. Instead of an oval loop at one end to feed the strap, it's just a strip of velcro. Certainly not enough to affect a 5-Star Rating. I'm considering getting another.
customer_reviews.author: TeddyJr

customer_reviews.title: Failed Arm Support
customer_reviews.text: I was able to install it without difficulty within a few minutes. I hung an extremely lightweight road bike on it and one of the arms dropped within five minutes. I thought it was something I did and upon inspection, noticed the “gear” like edges on the back side that wear supposed to secure the arm at the height desired, they were made of a soft metal and completely stripped when it dropped. Now I have a bike hanging very lopsided, and I hesitate to even hang the heavier bike I have.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S

customer_reviews.title: DEFECTIVE DESIGN!  DO NOT BUY.  HAZARD.
customer_reviews.text: DEFECTIVE DESIGN! DO NOT BUY. HAZARD. The adjustable arms do not hold the weight of the bike and slip down to the lowest position, dumping the bike on the person hanging the bike, the floor, or you toddler or pet. Waste of my time, now I have holes in the wall and have to start again. Of course there is no number to call. It was "Amazon Recommends": when I bought it, one well later it is "Sponsored" so apparently Amazon profits off if selling this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Beckman

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete piece of garbage. Do not buy. The ratcheting adjustments are made of plastic posing as some soft made in China metal. The ratchets gave out, bike fell, and broke a few things nearby (fishing rods). Too bad. Good design but poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Rvalue

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I wondered about having to use re-enforced wood screws or butterfly screws so I did. I didn't take any chances and I found a stud in my garage door. I drilled straight through and the mount fastened easy enough to the wall, through up my bike and it held fine. It's very adjustable to be able to widen left to right or to also have one side higher the the other if you have a slope bar on your bicycle, good as advertised have had it for a few months and still good.
customer_reviews.author: GM

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased two of these now as they are versatile enough to hang both of my (beach cruiser) bikes. Was able to hang a women’s and men’s style bike with this and the mount seems very sturdy. Make sure you find a stud and utilize at least 2 of the top 3 screw holes. The hardware that came with the mount was plenty to get this installed. Tools required (ladder, drill, stud finder, allen wrenches to secure mount arms to wall bar)
customer_reviews.author: E.Capo

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable arms do not last long
customer_reviews.text: I was superhappy with this hanger, was using my bike daily for commute and it allowed me to hang it in my small apartment without too much trouble (you need tools to install it). After 4 months thou one of the adjustable arms just loosened too much and cannot be held in place by the dented wheel behind anymore. My bike is still on the hanger, over 7 months passed but am not sure it'll last to spring. Have tried to contact seller for help / warranty substitution but couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: Olga P.

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because my wife got a different bike and the hanger we had wouldn't work (no upper bar on bike). The main issue I had was hanging it on the wall. I have open walls (wall studs showing) in the garage. I had to add an additional piece to the stud in order to be able to get all the screws into something. If I didn't, the screws would of been barely in the wood. Once I had it mounted, had to do it all over again due to I miss judge how high it need to go. Doesn't balance as nicely since the hanger is lower and the center of gravity is mostly above the hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hartwig

customer_reviews.title: Keep searching.
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed at first. Easy setup and I liked that you can adjust how far the unit stands off the wall. The cogs are some kind of sheet steel, though, and have a very precarious mate and sketchy design. Under load, mine misaligns and eventually fails. I caught my bike on its way down the first time thinking I had bumped it. It failed on it's own the second time and I found my car had caught the bike. I would recommend staying far away from this hanger.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Need 3mm AND 4mm Allen key
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine mount if installed correctly into a stud. I used longer screws than the ones provided since my garage has 5/8” drywall (as opposed to drywall typically used indoors which is 3/8”). My gripe is the instructions state you need a 4mm Allen key. This is only half correct. The 4mm is only used to adjust parts H and G (circled yellow in my image). To install it, you actually need a 3mm to connect parts A and F using screws E (circled in red). Ultimately, I had to buy two different Allen keys because they do not provide the appropriate one, the fasteners are not all the same size, and the instructions are inaccurate.
customer_reviews.author: Pech

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic scratches your bike if you aren't careful
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty rad bike hanger, but it has a flaw. The part of the hanger that touches the bike is made of hard plastic. They put a little fabric ring in the bottom of the channel, but on both sides the hard plastic rubs on your bike. I cut one of my kids socks into pieces and looped them around the plastic hanger part of the device to protect my bike. It is kind of ridiculous that I had to do this to keep the hanger from scratching my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Hull

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them and they are exactly what I was looking for, I have not tried anything else as I did a bunch of research first and this item did exactly what I needed it to do; hold the bike at various angles to maximize my limited space, attach securely to the wall, adjust depth to and from the wall. It came with some small screws and a couple drywall plugs but I didnt use them, I opted for a little bit more strength and went with stud screws instead. The velcro holds the front wheel straight and secure also, very happy with these bike racks!
customer_reviews.author: db2471

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Tip: Follow the directions exactly for a no trouble installation. Definitely use a 2x6 or larger to span at least 2 wall studs. Bikes are usually too heavy to use hollow wall anchors. We love them...tires a little bit off the floor and a perfect height to lift onto the holder.
customer_reviews.author: teach68

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect....
customer_reviews.text: I'll echo what other's have stated already: Mount a board to the wall, then mount hanger to the board. Also, it would be an improvement if the manufacturer would switch out the fasteners to be a pan head rather than a tapered head. It's a bit annoying, but not awful. Lastly, it would be nice if you could adjust it to sit closer to the wall. The way it is designed, you are unable to make use of the full travel "offered" by the adjustment slot.
customer_reviews.author: ItsWern

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: Gosh this was such an easy install. I think it's a pretty good deal as well. My bike is a bit on the heavy side and this supports it really well. Its built solid and grips the bike easily without worrying about it getting scratched. I kid you not, it took five minutes or less to screw in and mount (giggitty). I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Miramontes Jr

customer_reviews.title: Weak tooth locking mechanism
customer_reviews.text: We had bought two of these one for my husbands and one for my bike. After a couple times of taking the bike on and off to use it the adjustable tooth locks broke. So now my bike doesn’t hang straight. My husbands recently broke as well. This is a good option if you DON’T use your bike often. However we bike every weekend and the bike holder couldn’t not withstand the constant load and un loading.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Not built to last. Holding mechanism gave quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Was initially happy with this purchase. Havent had a lot of time riding in the last year so the bikes were constantly on this rack. And i was amazed that the teeth of the locking mechanism have been rounded and can no longer hold the weight and slips. I guess the material for the gears is not heavy duty for long term use. Will need to replace them now.
customer_reviews.author: Aman T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well-quick install A+
customer_reviews.text: I use some better screws and drilled pilot hole to stud and then ran screws. Works fine for what I need it... I ride the mountain bike more so chose this rack as more of a display then everyday. I think it’s fine and would work nice in an apartment or garage. Bought another one for road bike
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism's latch needs to be a little thicker to stay in place; otherwise, with little heavy force (you can test by hand pressing it down), the latch wiggles and jumps to the next slot and continues until all the way down to the last slot. I have tightened the screw at the latch, but it still happened. I believe it's a design issue and the metal latch needs to be a little thicker for it to stay in place. All the best. CT
customer_reviews.author: Chris T.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and adaptable to number of frames
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. I ended up installing as I’m more comfortable using the drill than my husband. Took about 20 each. Now our garage is organized, efficient with all space maximized. The bikes up on the wall look like a show room. Love that they are adaptable to any frame we own. Most of all love that it holds the frame, not the bikes wheels. Don’t have to worry about long storage damaging the wheels. For instal you’ll need stud finder and drill.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for 6 Months, then Arms Stopped Staying in Place
customer_reviews.text: Along with other posters, I agree with the need to install this into a wall that can hold the weight. That part of the product works great and overall it looks good. However, about 6 months after I bought this product, one of the adjustable arms stopped staying in place. I've always placed the bike back onto the mount carefully, and I have a fairly light road bike. Unfortunately, I'm now pretty worried that the adjustable arm is going to give way and that the bike will simply fall at some point.
customer_reviews.author: jdimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Super product that is well built and well supported.
customer_reviews.text: About 3 months ago I bought 4 of these and mounted them on my garage walls (cinder block).They are great and get the bikes off the ground. I have cruiser bikes with wide handlebars and the distance that the hanger comes out from the wall works great with them. After about 2 months one of the arms (I have 8 arms - 2 per unit) would not lock. I followed all the directions on the company's website and sent in a warranty claim which was answered quickly and courteously by Ian Yang from the customer service department and within one week I received a new replacement unit. They certainly stand behind their product. Very pleased!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough parts. Zero instructions
customer_reviews.text: Three long screws. Three drywall anchors. Four holes for long screws. One unexplained roll of Velcro. Two adjustment screws, hex. Zero hex wrench or hex size mentioned. Zero instructions accompanied.
customer_reviews.author: MattBianco

customer_reviews.title: Lever Arms don't hold for very long.
customer_reviews.text: Lever arm gears slip after a while. Didn't last long. Very disappointing. Sounds like it is a very common problem with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Armenta

customer_reviews.title: Good way to hang most bikes - Challenging if bike frame tubes are non-standard
customer_reviews.text: I use this bike hanger for my daughters bike which has a unique frame design. I like the adjustable arms to compensate for the bike frame not being parallel with the wheels. Once I accidently bumped the bike hanging on the mount and the clip that holds the swing arm is it's location popped free and it dropped down. No damage to the bike or the mount but it seemed like the clip could have been made to be a bit more sturdy to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good Looking Wall Rack
customer_reviews.text: I installed this wall rack in 30 minutes into a breezeblock wall, with no problems. Although other reviewers critique the wall plugs supplied, I found them to be adequate. I would siggest that considering the price of the rack, a simple torque tool should be supplied, I was fortunate to have the correct size. The bracket looks to be well constructed, although time will tell how it stands up to regular use.
customer_reviews.author: Martin J. Lipman

customer_reviews.title: Came off after 5 minutes
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to use this product but after setting this up on my concrete wall with the screw anchor the product came off shortly after 5-10 minutes... Not sure where to go from here or if I need extra mount. Please be careful when buying this product as it may come off with a little added pressure when mounting the bike off.
customer_reviews.author: Kyo Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great product to hang a bike on a wall.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy easy to install bike hanger. I use to hang a bike in my garage. I wanted to mount it high enough on my wall to clear a ladder stored at waist higher. Getting a large steel frame mountain bike up and on the arms is bit of a heavy lift. My aluminum mountain bike goes on easy when I use that one. The bikes are stable and stay in place. No damage to the drywall. I screwed it directly into a stud, so it's not going anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ramblin Man

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: We bought 5 of them and attached them all to studs instead of using the wall anchors (+ our drywall sucks). They’ve held up great, especially with a 5 year old tugging his bike off the hanger/wall. They’re very easy to adjust for the different size/style bikes. We also hung them higher to leave room for things on the ground/shelving units and the bikes are easy to remove even with stuff below them.
customer_reviews.author: Emme D.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Adjustable Mount
customer_reviews.text: I used it to display an old school Banana Seat Schwinn and it worked great cause I was able to adjust the arms to fit around the curved frame of the bike. Strong and durable quality even though some of the pieces on the arm gears are plastic, the plastic seem that it's of pretty good quality.
customer_reviews.author: lore valdes

customer_reviews.title: Best fixie wall mount out there!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Stylish. Easy to mount. Secured. Excellent price/value. Our track fixies look like works of art hanging from the wall atop the sofa and desk. Very satisfied with this purchase and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: airsick365

customer_reviews.title: Solid Bike Hanger
customer_reviews.text: We just moved from a single family house to a townhouse and had to hang a few things on the garage wall to free up some space. This bike hanger is a very solid product that was simple to install. It is well built and simple to operate. We bought two, and I had both mounted and both bikes hanging in less than 10 minutes. The two support "handles" are simple to adjust, as is the distance from the wall. This is a very solid product.
customer_reviews.author: R. J. House

customer_reviews.title: Nice Rack for Bike
customer_reviews.text: This was fairly easy to install if you have the correct tools. Although the screw holes are weird. You want to screw this into a stud, however, the screw holes won't line up with the width of a stud unless you turn it sideways a little bit. So I had to hang mine somewhat off-center to get it to work. It's been very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, minimalist, looks amazing. Turned my bike into wall-art!
customer_reviews.text: Ummm - awesome is all I can say. Installed with ease, make sure to drill a pilot hole if you are installing into a stud. Having this rack include an adjustable wall distance was a good idea, I situated my bike the perfect distance from the wall to be able to allow the wheel to turn 90 degrees and rest against a little wood plate I added to the wall to prevent the rubber from scuffing the tire (the rack included a velcro strap to keep the wheel straight, but that seems like a lot of work to add/remove each time I take the bike out the front door).
customer_reviews.author: Chad Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Great design, Easy Installation.
customer_reviews.text: This product is exactly what I needed for our small apartment. The design is simplistic yet robust. I like that I can keep the bikes far away enough from the wall so that the pedals dont mark it. Also, aesthetically it adds to the urban-life wall art theme I was going for. The instructions were very clear and I had no problem using them. I used a stud finder and drilled very small pilot holes to make it easy to tighen the phillips-head mounting screws down. The result is a very sturdy hanger that easily holds our 17lb and 20lb road bikes. I highly recommend this hanger for your bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: J.Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and versatile
customer_reviews.text: Nicely engineered, sturdy, and padded in just the right places to support the bike without scratching it. Easy to install; just make sure you find a stud in the wall to attach it too. I wouldn't be to confident in mounting it with just drywall anchor screws, etc.
customer_reviews.author: cb

customer_reviews.title: Not using it for a bike, but still great!
customer_reviews.text: I use a pair of them to hold add-ons for my exercise unit on the wall when not attached. They are very robust, configurable and can hold quite a bit of weight. They'd be good for almost anything you want to store on a wall. Easy to install as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy2two

customer_reviews.title: Good. Can be better.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product for lightweight bicycles. I needed something simple to mount my kid's bike. I knew better not to mount it directly to drywall, but I went ahead and tried just because the instructions said I could and the bike is made of light aluminum frame. Middle of the night, I heard a loud noise. Sure enough it was the bike falling off the wall. Re-mounted with a wooden frame. It looks sturdy now. I would suggest the instructions manual to omit direct drywall mounting instructions.
customer_reviews.author: S. Muthusamy

customer_reviews.title: Extension pole too long for a road bike
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great bracket if you have a mountain bike or hybrid with wide handlebars or a lot of room where you're hanging it. I have a road bike hung in a garage next to a car, so it's just *** ("okay"). With the bracket pushed all of the way to the wall, my handlebars are still 2" from the wall, so the bike sticks out further from the wall than I would like. Given the location of the mount, I want as much space as possible so I will be replacing this with a different bracket at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Valued Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak Teeth on adjustment arms
customer_reviews.text: The teeth on the adjustment arms are far too weak and bend very easily. If you have a really light bike you shouldn’t have any problems but once it’s set, I would leave it in that position so you minimize the chances of damaging them.
customer_reviews.author: Noga Family

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: Could be better made, doesn't hold weight of bike and tends to slip. I use it to support my bike inside a trailer and then use ratchet tie downs to suspend it from the ceiling. The straps take the support over from the rack.
customer_reviews.author: Paperboy

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I have two of my bikes hanging up, one over my computer, and they hold so well that I have no doubt they will be coming down. I didn't have studs where I wanted to hang them, so I did use my own drywall anchors that hold ~95lbs each.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Steffens

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight bikes only. Do not believe the weight rating.
customer_reviews.text: If you put a 30 lb mountain bike on this it will bend the adjustable arm and ruin it. This would be fine for extremely light weight bikes. But for a $250 mountain bike or any bike around that price range or below you had better pass.
customer_reviews.author: Jmarckson

customer_reviews.title: Simply Awesome Bike Wall Hangers
customer_reviews.text: This bike wall hanger is amazing. I literally can’t put into words how much I enjoy having two of these in my garage for my bikes. After each ride, I simply hang them up and they’re out of the way. The wall hanger is very sturdy and took 5 mins to install into the studs.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Bike Holder
customer_reviews.text: I was a little apprehensive about this product but decided to give it a try. Wow! What a surprise! When I hung the bikes in the garage it looked really professional. The neighbors were so impressed they purchased them also. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The nails included where not wood nails. I had to use different nails because they would not go through the stud. Once installed it looked good and is very sturdy. It’s been about 4 months since installation and the bike is still hanging.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Works good.
customer_reviews.text: Great way to get more floor space. My mountain bike with wide bars hit the wall at the max extension but a slight turn and it barely clears. The velcro strap barely connects with long travel forks but isn't really necessary. Mount into a wall stud and you are all good. I wouldn't try to use it as a replacement for a work stand. Pivots are nice to make you bike level with a sloping frame.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Study mount! Perfect for Brick!
customer_reviews.text: THIS MOUNT IS FOR BRICK WALLS. For this purpose, it works perfectly Pro tip: Go buy a new masonry drill bit that is sharp and the. Correct size for your anchors. Follow the engineer’s review about how to mount if mounting on dry wall. Buy your own anchors
customer_reviews.author: Marta MTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Arms are weak.  Doesn’t seem to last. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of this wall hanger and was super excited for it. I hung it on the wall and for the first month + it worked fine. Unfortunately after that the arm that holds the rear tire side no longer stays in place. Anytime there’s even the slightest load on it, the arm falls. My bike is under the max weight limit, so either I got a bum unit or it’s an engineering flaw. I’d return it, but unfortunately this started after the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Williams

customer_reviews.title: Bike Just Fits
customer_reviews.text: This Installation was easy. My new 21 inch Mountain bike just fits. I have a half inch gap from the wall to the handlebar if I extend bike rack to its limit. My upper frame tube is flat so I use an old Shammy to protect the bike. I’m worried over time the plastic will scratch the paint. I gave it four stars only because I would like the plastic holders to expand a little bit for the flat wide top frame tube.
customer_reviews.author: Javan & Alma

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!  Easy to install and looks fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Was simple to install, and looks great as well. Very sturdy and easy to adjust to position the bike exactly where you want it to be. Love the simplicity in looks and how it doesn’t detract from the main focus like other products. Great product! Bravo!
customer_reviews.author: BadAndy

customer_reviews.title: Bite The Bullet - Buy This One
customer_reviews.text: seemed a little spendy for a bike mount, but if you invested thousands into your bike, you may want to make sure it is not going to fall off the wall and dent your wife's Jeep Grand cherokee. I used some longer screws than the ones provided (they should provide at least 2" screws) but other than that, this thing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: But I don't recommend the screws that it came with it's best to ...
customer_reviews.text: This product for your bike is a must have if your in need of space and the style is top of the line . But I don't recommend the screws that it came with it's best to go to your local hardware store and get heavy duty screws if your going to put this on your wall just to make sure it does not fall on you . Also comes with a cool strap for your wheel so it stays still . And the way it hold your bike in place where the handles are its good so your bike does not get any stretches other then that it would have gotten a 5 star .
customer_reviews.author: Alexzy Rivera Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Ibera Horizontal Bicycle Bike Wall Hanger. Love it.
customer_reviews.text: This bicycle wall stand was easy to install. Real easy to adjust to hold my bike and very stable. It's also very well made. I have a feeling it will outlast my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Juan J.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Stable
customer_reviews.text: I was able to hang it on wall relatively easily after finding the right spot. Now i hang my son's bike there , saved a lot of space. wanted to upload the picture but not sure why i am not seeing image upload option.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great price,originally liked but over short period locking feature failed
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product, hang both of my bikes on them, very sturdy. Followed installation instructions - I mounted board onto wall and then mounted rack onto board since you have to install to a stud and not drywall. Works great. Originally worked well but over a few months the locking mechanism on one unit won't hold my carbon fiber (light) road bike. Great idea just wish it held up.
customer_reviews.author: Bluesmgb

customer_reviews.title: Paid for a cheap and useless product
customer_reviews.text: Zero stability should have zero stars. What a waste of money and time. This worked greatness for about 2 months, at this point the bike rack is useless. It CANNOT hold up the bike in a stable way. It’s a very very very bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuelle  Brezault

customer_reviews.title: Cool idea
customer_reviews.text: Cool idea, almost the right execution. The fork depths were a bit too wide for my bike frame to rest on the plastic parts, so my cables and hydraulics are pinched by the cradle bottoms instead. Got some thicker foam pipe insulation from HD, and it transformed the mount! Also, I decided to cover The bolts in front with more foam, to prevent paint scratches when mounting the bike
customer_reviews.author: Michael A.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stylish!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I each have this bike mount. It’s so nice to have our bikes raised off the floor. Makes our garage look super sharp and organized. It was fairly easy easy to install once you find the studs. It’s easy to get the bike on and off the mount. It feels very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: AmberHale

customer_reviews.title: Minimal bike frame scratch protection
customer_reviews.text: I loved this item initially, except that there was not enough frame scratch protection in the grips. Thick frames mountain bikes will exceed the minimal scratch protection. Disappointing as I liked the versatility of hanger. Returned for another full rubber gripped item
customer_reviews.author: Brian Manzotti

customer_reviews.title: Accommodates any size bike!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Don’t hesitate to order. My husband tried several other bike racks before this one. It looks commercial. I trust my convertible car being parked beside it with confidence. It fit my child’s beach cruiser my husbands mountain bike and my elementary school child’s bike as well. No matter what size or style these bike racks can accommodate any size bike. Highly recommend. I shop on Amazon weekly!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Ibera Horizontal Bicycle Bike Wall Hanger, Bike Hook Holder Storage Rack for Indoor Storage, 45 Degree Adjustable Angle to Keep Your Bike Level
feature_bullets: The wall hanger's angle (45°) can adjust to keep your bike level. Correct height for hanger tyres should sit atleast 4 inch off floor or ground. Bracket must be mounted 2 hole side up
Designed as a horizontal mounting wall hanger for a single bike to save floor space. Weight limit- 39.6 pounds
The sturdy and durable construction made out of aluminum makes this hanger safe for bikes to hang on the wall
The double arm hanger has padded ABS arms to keep the bike secure and protects against paint damage
Suitable for most conventional bike frames. Hanger beam length is adjustable to fit narrow or wide handlebars

Mount hanger on masonry or concrete wall with anchors. Do not mount hanger on plasterboard wall or dry wall unless there is a wood stud behind. If you have any questions about the installation, seek for professional help.
100% Satisfaction Guarantee - Backed by Ibera 30 days Money Back Guarantee with limited lifetime product warranty. Helmets or other bike gear can be hung from hanger beam

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
